intro: Stizolobium poggei, commonly known as the Pogge's legume, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. The seeds are enclosed in elongated pods, which dry and split open to release the seeds.
